comment.author: 38714066@N00
comment._content: What is the purpose of the little booth on top of the Prouds marquee?

comment.realname: State Library of New South Wales
comment.author: 29454428@N08
comment._content: Hi Seth, When Sydney had one of the largest tram networks in the world, these signal boxes high off the street controlled the traffic. Sadly the last tram ran in 1961 and the streets were doomed to be clogged for ever
comment.authorname: State Library of New South Wales collection

comment.author: 38714066@N00
comment._content: Sad how they're gone from so many cities.  I bet the motorman of the tram in the background is furious that all these pedestrians are blocking the track ;)

comment.author: 86916510@N00
comment._content:
I think what is sad is that they are marching to commemorate the fallen and are about to go and do it all again.
It reminds me of the Australian War memorial in France I visited once which was so ironically spared no dignity when the Germans shot it up in WW2. The bell tower was even bombed so it couldn't be used as a sniper refuge. The bullet holes are still there today.
